content:
• Monday, July 9, 2018
  • YAHOY

    Yahoo Japan plans buyback in three-way deal with Altaba, SoftBank

    • Yahoo Japan (OTCPK:YAHOY) will buy back about $2B worth of its shares in a three-way deal with top shareholders SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBY) and Altaba (NASDAQ:AABA), the former Yahoo.
    • That's slightly more than the amount Yahoo Japan was reportedly considering -- ¥200B worth, about $1.8B.
    • Yahoo Japan will buy the shares from SoftBank Group. SoftBank in turn will see its stake in Yahoo Japan rise to about 48%, and Altaba will sell down its stake by about $2B (leaving it with about 27%).
    • That will happen via SoftBank buying ¥221B of Yahoo Japan shares from Altaba through a tender offer at Monday's closing price, followed by Yahoo Japan buying ¥220B worth from SoftBank.
    • In Tokyo now: SoftBank up 2.1%; Yahoo Japan up 11.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 PM | 8 Comments
  • ADMP

    Adamis Pharma files for $150M mixed shelf offering; shares down 4% after hours

    • Adamis Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADMP) has filed a prospectus for a $150M mixed shelf offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:55 PM | 83 Comments
  • TWTR

    JPMorgan: Buy Twitter's dip after confusing account report

    • Twitter (NYSE:TWTR) ended up mitigating the biggest part of its decline today spurred by a Friday report about user account suspensions, and JPMorgan for one said to buy the dip.
    • "We'd be taking advantage of the weakness," say analyst Doug Anmuth, who says a Washington Post report sowed "confusion" about whether removing 70M fake accounts would hit user numbers to be reported later this month. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Improving quality is critical for service health, he writes (there he's in agreement with CFO Ned Segal); and he believes a significant number of the suspended accounts were dormant more than 30 days and therefore don't end up as monthly active users.
    • He still expects 2M net adds for Twiter's MAUs in a seasonally light quarter, vs. zero adds a year ago (and 6M net adds in Q1).
    • The firm has a $50 price target, implying 13% upside from today's close. Shares closed down 5.4% today and are ticking up 0.1% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 PM | 37 Comments
  • WHD

    Cactus plans 10M-share public offering

    • Cactus (NYSE:WHD) -5.7% after-hours on news it has commenced a public offering of 10M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase as much as 1.5M additional shares.
    • WHD says it plans to contribute the proceeds to its Cactus Wellhead subsidiary in exchange for common units representing limited liability company interests in Cactus LLC.
    • WHD also estimates revenues for its June quarter will total $136M-$139M vs. $82M for last year's June quarter, with net income of $40.6M-$42.4M vs. $16.6M in the year-ago quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • ISR

    IsoRay +143% after FDA clears brachytherapy technology

    • IsoRay (NYSEMKT:ISR) more than doubled in today's trade and +12% after-hours on news that the Food and Drug Administration cleared its GammaTile therapy for treatment of recurrent brain tumors.
    • ISR says its GammaTile therapy leverages Cesium-131’s ability to deliver a highly targeted dose of intense radiation treatment while limiting radiation exposure to surrounding tissue.
    • The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services already clarified the coding for GammaTile in the hospital setting by assigning GammaTile therapy to a new, specific ICD-10-PCS code; now that the FDA has issued regulatory clearance, ISR says the therapy can be made available in the near future to patients served by hospitals throughout the U.S.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • CELG

    Celgene, Acceleron announce positive results in blood disorder drug study

    • Celgene (NASDAQ:CELG) and Acceleron Pharma (NASDAQ:XLRN) say their jointly developed Luspatercept drug achieved primary and all key secondary endpoints in a Phase 3 clinical trial for treatment of transfusion-dependent Beta-Thalassemia.
    • The companies say the drug significantly lowered the rate of transfusions needed in patients with the blood disorder where abnormal hemoglobin production causes anemia.
    • CELG +1.7%, XLRN +11.6% after-hours in response to the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 11 Comments
  • OCX

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (07/09/2018)

    • Top gainers: OCX +63.0%. ATEC +7.4%. OTCQX:AMPY +3.3%. CRR +2.9%. GBR +2.7%.
    • Top Losers: GRPN -5.0%. WHD -4.0%.  FTD -2.7%. MRBK -1.4%. CRI -1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • GOGO

    Gogo slides as Guggenheim trims estimates ahead of call

    • Gogo (NASDAQ:GOGO) finished the day down 6.5% -- but not before tagging an all-time low -- after Guggenheim reduced estimates, the latest blow in a tough year for the aviation connectivity provider.
    • Shares are down 59.5% YTD, with its biggest decline coming in the days after its earnings report in May when the company pulled its annual forecasts.
    • It's set to discuss a new integrated business plan before the market opens on Friday, with key conclusions from its review due after Thursday's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM | 17 Comments
  • SFUN

    Fang Holdings rises after MoU for 10% stake in Chongqing Wanli New Energy

    • Fang Holdings (NYSE:SFUN) rises 2.4% in after-hours trading after announcing it's in a preliminary agreement to acquire 10% equity interest in Chongqing Wanli New Energy for 500M yuan (US$75.6M) cash consideration from its controlling stockholder.
    • As part of the non-binding memorandum, the seller agrees to purchase from Wanli its battery business for at least 680M yuan within three years after the transaction.
    • Wanli New Energy trades on the Shanghai Stock Exchange.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM | 2 Comments
  • OCX

    OncoCyte reports better-than-expected results from lung cancer liquid biopsy test; shares up 56% after hours

    • Thinly traded micro cap OncoCyte (NYSEMKT:OCX) is up 56% after hours on average volume in response to its announcement that a study of its DetermaVu lung cancer test based on Next Gen Sequencing (NGS), an enhanced algorithm and incorporating new biomarkers showed a level of performance beyond expectations.
    • The company says the use of the NGS platform may enable decentralized operations beyond its CLIA lab and the development of a CE-Mark'd test kit that could be distributed in Europe.
    • It plans to further test the new biomarkers on a broader set of samples aimed at selecting the best biomarker panel and algorithm. It expects to complete the expanded R&D validation study by year-end and the clinical validation study in H1 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • INSP

    Aetna to cover Inspire neurostimulation device for obstructive sleep apnea; shares up 5% after hours

    • Thinly traded Inspire Medical Systems (NYSE:INSP) is up 5% after hours in response to its announcement that health insurer Aetna will cover its hypoglossal nerve neurostimulation device, Inspire Therapy, for the treatment of obstructive sleep apnea for its 22M members.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • SPRO

    Spero readies stock offering; shares down 1% after hours

    • Spero Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SPRO) commences a public offering of 4.5M shares of common stock. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 675K shares. Price and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 1% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • PCAR

    PACCAR reloads buyback program

    • PACCAR (NASDAQ:PCAR) announces that its board approved the repurchase of an additional $300M worth of stock.
    • The company recently completed its previously authorized $300M share repurchase program.
    • “PACCAR’s excellent net profits and cash flow deliver good returns for its shareholders," maintains Executive Chairman Mark Pigott. "The company’s shareholder return has averaged 12.5 percent in the last fifteen years, compared to the S&P 500 Index return of 9.5 percent," he notes.
    • PCAR +1.07% after hours to $62.50.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • STAF

    Staffing 360 skyrockets on huge volume

    • Staffing 360 Solutions (STAF +282.5%) makes a monster move off acquisition news from this morning.
    • The spike looks to be of the speculative side without a whole lot of financial details issued with the press release on the pickup of Clement May Limited.
    • Trading volume on the staffing stock is over 21M shares.
    • Previously: Staffing 360 Solutions announces acquisition of Clement May in the UK (July 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 5 Comments
  • CISN

    Cision +3.4% as RBC starts at Outperform

    • Cision (NYSE:CISN) is up 3.4% after a start at Outperform by RBC Capital.
    • The company owns about 20% of a $3.5B public-relations software market, Matthew Hedberg says, and he expects faster organic revenue growth from an already profitable position.
    • He has a price target of $20, implying nearly 26% further upside.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • CYTX

    Cytori gives up early gains, down 12%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Cytori Therapeutics (CYTX -12.2%) is down on below-average volume. Share were up over 10% early in the session before retracing.
    • Earlier today, the company announced the publication of results from a Denmark-based study evaluating Cytori Cell Therapy in men with erectile dysfunction (ED) following radical prostatectomy (surgical removal of the prostate).
    • A single administration of the autologous adipose-derived regenerative cells produced a significant improvement in incontinence, but their effect on ED was mixed. At month 12 after surgery, median Erection Hardness Scores were unchanged in the combined group of 21 patients, but improved slightly in a subset of patients who were continent. Over half (53.3%) of continent patients (n=8/15) could function well enough for intercourse.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • GEN

    Genesis Healthcare down 14% after Sabra transaction

    • Genesis Healthcare (GEN -13.7%) is down on more than triple normal volume. Earlier today, Sabra Health Care REIT (SBRA -1.8%) announced the completion of the sale of nine facilities to Genesis for $81.4M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 5 Comments
  • ASRT

    Depomed up 16% on reported patent settlement with Purdue Pharma

    • Depomed (DEPO +15.9%) is up on triple normal volume in response to its reported patent settlement with Purdue Pharma. Details are scarce, however.
    • Update: The company is currently negotiating with Purdue to settle the patent infringement dispute.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • LEDS

    SemiLEDs high on movers chart with 39% gain

    • SemiLEDs (NASDAQ:LEDS) opened up $0.21 today but has moved through the afternoon to rise 39% and become one of the market's top movers today.
    • The move's coming on no catalyst in particular.
    • Volume's already quadruple normal, though -- and actually more than 10 times recent slow volume.
    • More than three-quarters of shares are held by insiders, according to Yahoo Finance, and the short percentage of float stands at 9.14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • LEDS

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (07/09/2018)

    • Gainers: LEDS +36%. NNDM +19%. AUO +12%. XNET +10%. OTCPK:LFIN +10%.
    • Losers: IOTS -20%. EGAN -15%. PS -9%. BOXL -7%. IGLD -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean upgraded, Oasis Petroleum downgraded at Susquehanna

    • Transocean (RIG +4.6%) enjoys strong gains after Susquehanna upgrades shares to Positive from Neutral with a $16 price target, while the firm downgrades Oasis Petroleum (OAS +0.8%) to Neutral from Positive with a $14 price target.
    • "Offshore floater contracting activity has begun to rebound, and we believe more positive commentary across several of the companies suggests the industry is beginning to heal, and better utilization could be ahead in 2019 and 2020," Susquehanna says in raising its rating on RIG for more leverage to the sector.
    • The firm thinks OAS shares, however, are fully valued after rising 55% YTD while the SPDR S&P Oil and Gas Exploration and Production ETF (NYSEARCA:XOP) is just 18% higher.
    • Investors who want exposure to companies with substantial non-Permian production should instead buy Marathon Oil (MRO +3.3%), which the firm rates Positive with a $26 price target, improved from $24.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 23 Comments
  • BAC

    Banks climb for third day anticipating strong earnings

    • Financial stocks gain for the third day ahead of Q2 earnings reports, which kick off later this week. The Financial Select Sector SPDR ETF gains  2.3% in midafternoon trading, while the S&P Banks Select Industry Index also climbs 2.3%.
    • Bank of America (BAC +3.6%) logged the largest gain of the big U.S. banks, while New York Community Bancorp (NYCB +3.5%) rose the most among regional banks.
    • Friday will be a big day for bank earnings: Citigroup (C +2.7%), Wells Fargo (WFC +1.9%), JPMorgan (JPM +3.2%), and PNC Financial(PNC +2.3%) all report quarterly earnings.
    • Other gainers for today: BofI Holdings (BOFI +2.9%), SunTrust Banks (STI +3.4%), KeyCorp (KEY +3.1%),  Bank of the Ozarks (OZRK +2.9%), and BB&T (BBT +2.8%).
    • For the past month, the S&P Banks Select Industry Index is down 2.6%, but it's up 3.4% year-to-date.
    • The optimism for financial stocks appears to be global. Royal Bank of Canada (RY +0.8%), Bank of Montreal (BMO +0.7%), and Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce (CM +0.7%) rose. The only major Canadian bank to decline is Toronto-Dominion Bank (TD -0.2%).
    • HSBC Holdings (HSBC +1.6%), Credit Suisse (CS +2.2%), and Barclays (BCS +1.2%) lead overseas-based banks higher.
    • Investors also seem optimistic about credit card companies as American Express (AXP +1.5%), Synchrony Financial (SYF +3.3%), Capital One (COF +4.1%), Discover Financial (DFS +2%), and Alliance Data Systems (ADS +1.4%) all gaining more than 1%.
    • Previously: Futures build on last week's gains (July 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 28 Comments
  • SWK

    Stanley Black & Decker to pay $100M in Rhode Island site cleanup, DoJ says

    • Stanley Black & Decker (SWK +1.8%) agrees to pay $100M to help clean up dioxin contaminated sediment and soil at the Centredale Manor Restoration Project Superfund Site in Rhode Island, the U.S. Department of Justice announces.
    • The cleanup remedy includes excavation of contaminated sediment and floodplain soil from the Woonasquatucket River, including from adjacent residential properties, the DoJ says.
    • SWK says it is adding $78M to its reserve for the site to $146M, which will be reflected in its Q2 2018 financial results.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • TAT

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (07/09/2018)

    • Gainers: TAT +15%. MCF +13%. GEVO +13%. PVG +12%. TGA +11%.
    • Losers: GBR -18%. PED -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • AMZN

    Snap gains on report of Amazon search tie-in

    • Some digging by an app researcher reveals hidden code inside of SnapChat that delivers search users to Amazon (AMZN +1.1%) listings.
    • Visual product search could make Snapchat’s camera tool a differentiator from Instagram, says TechCrunch Editor-At-Large Josh Constine.
    • Shares of Snap (NYSE:SNAP) are up 2.68% on the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 37 Comments
  • RHHBY

    Biotechs give up gains after Trump tweet on prices

    • The SPDR S&P Biotech ETF (XBI -0.7%) slips 1.5% from its intraday high of $101.17 after President Trump tweeted (again) his displeasure over recent price hikes by drug makers, including Pfizer.
    • Selected tickers: (XLV +0.6%)(IBB +0.1%)(IHE +0.5%)(XPH +1.1%)(PPH +0.5%)(VHT +0.5%)(OTCQX:RHHBY -0.1%)(PFE +0.3%)(AMGN +1.4%)(BIIB -2.4%)(GILD +2.4%)(VRTX -0.1%)(AGN +1.1%)(ABBV +0.5%)(LLY +0.8%)(GSK -0.2%)(AZN +0.4%)(JNJ +0.2%)(MRK)(NVS +0.4%)(SHPG +0.1%)(VRX +2.6%)(TEVA -0.5%)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 157 Comments
  • TWTR

    Twitter pares losses as CFO comments on user metrics

    • Responding to reports of a massive account sweep (and a precipitous stock fall today), Twitter Chief Financial Officer Ned Segal offers clarifications via his account.
    • "Some clarifications: most accounts we remove are not included in our reported metrics as they have not been active on the platform for 30 days or more, or we catch them at sign up and they are never counted," Segal says.
    • A Washington Post story on some 70M suspensions of fake accounts noted worries that the company might show a rare monthly user decline when it reports earnings later this month.
    • "If we removed 70M accounts from our reported metrics, you would hear directly from us," he goes on. "This article reflects us getting better at improving the health of the service. Look forward to talking more on our earnings call July 27!"
    • Shares in TWTR are rebounding somewhat, now down 4.5%; they were down as much as 9.8% at their session low today.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 34 Comments
  • IOTS

    Adesto Technologies reports preliminary Q2 results

    • Adesto Technologies (IOTS -21.8%) now expects revenue for the Q2 to be ~$18.1M to $18.3M vs. a consensus of $18.55M and prior expectations of $18.1M to $19.0M.
    • The company expects gross margin to be 42% to 44%, below the company’s prior expectations of 46% to 48%.
    • Previously: Adesto Technologies announces proposed public offering of common stock (July 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • CNI

    Canadian National Rail upgraded to Buy from Hold at Deutsche Bank

    • Canadian National Railway (CNI +2.7%) is higher after Deutsche Bank upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with a $95 price target, raised from $81, saying the company's period of incremental capital investment has "sown the seeds of recovery." with CNI now better prepared to capitalize on abundant top-line opportunities.
    • Following an uncharacteristically challenging period for CNI, the firm believes the company is now in a better position to benefit from the top-line growth opportunities it has been highlighting since its investor day last June.
    • Deutsche Bank also believes strong pricing and operating leverage will drive significant margin expansion and earnings growth, with its 2020 EPS forecast now 10% above consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 4 Comments
  • YAHOY

    Yahoo Japan mulls buyback to ease Altaba stake sale

    • Yahoo Japan (OTCPK:YAHOY) confirms a report that it's considering a share buyback but that decision hasn't been made.
    • Nikkei reported that the company may buy back ¥200B worth in a scheme to allow Altaba (NASDAQ:AABA) to sell part of its stake in Yahoo Japan.
    • ADRs are on the move today on Nasdaq: OTCPK:YAHOY +6.6%. Related: OTCPK:SFTBY +2.6%; AABA -0.5%.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 7 Comments
  • LC

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (07/09/2018)

    • Gainers: LC +7%. FANH +5%. BMA +5%. ELVT +5%.
    • Losers: IHT -8%. LX -7%. AIHS -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • PDS

    Precision Drilling +7% after winning Kuwait contract

    • Precision Drilling (PDS +6.8%) surges after winning a five-year contract award to build a ST-3000 drilling rig in Kuwait with an optional one year extension; financial terms are not disclosed.
    • PDS has five active rigs in Kuwait on long term contract and expects the sixth rig to begin operations in Q3 2019.
    • Also, PDS says it has 54 active rigs in Canada with visibility to exceed 60 active rigs by mid-August, surpassing peak rig count in Q3 a year ago, while demand in the U.S. strengthens with 78 rigs currently active and visibility to reach 80 rigs by the end of July.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • STAF

    Midday Gainers / Losers (07/09/2018)

    • Gainers: STAF +255%. BNTC +56%. EVK +26%. OTCPK:LFIN +17%. LEDS +15%. HELE +16%. NNDM +15%. TAT +14%. BBOX +12%. PVG +12%.
    • Losers: IOTS -24%. GBR -17%. FAMI -17%. CTIC -14%. DOVA -12%. PED -11%. PETS -10%. AKAO -9%. PRAN -9%. XBIO -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • JD

    JD, L Catterton partner with Secoo

    • JD.com (JD +0.2%) and private-equity based firm L Catterton Asia have set a strategic partnership with luxury retailer Secoo Holding Limited (SECO +6.4%).
    • That will include a $175M investment from JD and L Catterton's Asian division.
    • Secoo will leverage L Catterton's global fashion and retail expertise to pursue further expansion in the luxury market.
    • As for JD: "This partnership will help us enhance our luxury capabilities and provide the best possible luxury shopping experience to consumers in China," says the company's Shengli Hu. "Chinese consumers are increasingly discerning about their luxury purchases, demanding more variety and choice than ever."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 22 Comments
  • EVK

    Consumer - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (07/09/2018)

    • Gainers: EVK +32%. HELE +14%. JRSH +13%. LBIX-OLD +12%. RIBT +11%.
    • Losers: ABAC-OLD -14%. FAMI -12%. TIS -8%. JVA -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • NTDOY

    Nintendo +3% after CLSA raises to Buy

    • Nintendo (OTCPK:NTDOY) is up 3% in U.S. trading after a boost to Buy from CLSA, up from Outperform.
    • The firm updated its price target down to ¥44,000 from ¥54,000; that's a below-average price target that still implies 24% upside from current price.
    • Shares rose 2.5% in Tokyo today.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 5 Comments
  • WHLR

    Wheeler REIT gains as shareholder seeks to replace at least three directors

    • Wheeler REIT (NASDAQ:WHLR) gains as much as 2.6% after shareholder Stilwell Group issues a second letter to fellow shareholders, saying it wants to replace at least three legacy directors on the REIT's board.
    • Joseph Stilwell says a January issue of 1.4M shares of convertible preferred stock sold at an $8.50 discount to face value destroyed more than $12M in value for common stockholders--" something I've never seen occur at even a reasonably healthy company in my 35 years of working on Wall Street," Stilwell writes.
    • Stilwell Activist Investments beneficially owns about 671,610 shares of common stock.
    • WHLR has declined 44% since its closing stock price of $7.81 (adjusted for dividends) on Dec. 29, the last trading day of 2017.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: Wheeler REIT refinancing moves cut debt by more than $20M (June 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 6 Comments
  • GRKGF

    World Cup fever filters down to some bottom lines

    • Greene King (OTC:GRKGF, OTCPK:GKNGY) and Marston's (OTCPK:MARZF, OTC:MRTPY) are both up about 2.30% in London trading after England advanced to the semi-finals of the World Cup.
    • The extra games for the Three Lions essentially works out to the equivalent of a few days worth of extra revenue for the pub operators.
    • The strong performance by European teams could also boost results for Coca-Cola European Partners (NYSE:CCE-OLD) and Coca Cola HBC (OTC:CCHBF, OTCPK:CCHGY), according to analysts.
    • Nike (NKE +0.5%) has France, England and Croatia still alive in the tournament as far as uniform sponsorships, while Adidas (OTCQX:ADDYY) is down to Belgium. Reports indicate that England merchandise has been the hottest seller of the four teams still remaining.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 6 Comments
  • TGSGY

    TGS Nopec Geophysical updates on Q2 revenue

    • TGS Nopec Geophysical (OTCPK:TGSGY +6%) expects net revenues for the Q218 to be ~$158M (+47% Y/Y).
    • Kristian Johansen, CEO, TGS:  "Our strong Q2 revenue performance, driven by late sales from our data library, is further evidence of improvement in the global market for seismic data. Customer activity is significantly higher than one year ago, although E&P companies are still being selective and disciplined with respect to new data purchases. As such, the market is expected to remain volatile in the near-term".
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • BNTC

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (07/09/2018)

    • Gainers: BNTC +71%. KZIA +17%. PTIE +12%. INNT +10%. CVRS +8%.
    • Losers: CTIC -14%. DOVA -12%. LENS -10%. PRAN -9%. PETS -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • TWTR

    Twitter -8.4% after report of mass suspensions

    • Twitter (NYSE:TWTR) has led S&P downdrafters today, now -8.4%, in its first market action since a late-Friday report that the company is suspending more than a million accounts a day for fakery or spam involvement.
    • That number's high enough to lead to a drop in monthly users when the company issues its Q2 report.
    • Monthly active users were up 3% in Q1, to 336M.
    • The company's set to report before the open on July 27.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 67 Comments
  • DLPH

    Forward motion again for auto suppliers

    • Traders are showing some confidence in auto suppliers again as the latest trade/tariff developments are digested. An upgrade from Morgan Stanley on Delphi Technologies to Overweight from Equal-Weight is also helping to swing sentiment around to the positive side.
    • Notable gainers include Delphi Technologies (DLPH +5.7%), Dana (DAN +3.5%), American Axle & Manufacturing (AXL +3.2%), Meritor (MTOR +3.7%), BorgWarner (BWA +2.5%) and Allison Transmission Holdings (ALSN +2.1%). Overall, 29 out of the 37 publicly-traded auto supplier stocks with a market cap of over $50M are showing some sort of gain on the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 2 Comments
  • ACAD

    Acadia down 5% on bearish SIRF article

    • ACADIA Pharmaceuticals (ACAD -4.7%) slips on average volume on the heels of a bearish online article by the Southern Investigative Reporting Foundation (SIRF).
    • The article cites the previously reported level of adverse events related to Parkinson's disease psychosis med Nuplazid (pimavanserin).
    • Previously: Acadia down 20% on FDA relook at Nuplazid safety data (April 25)
    • Previously: Acadia Pharma down 17% premarket on Nuplazid safety concerns (April 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 52 Comments
  • PLAY

    Dinosaur rally for Dave & Buster's

    • Dave & Buster's Entertainment (PLAY +4.4%) is likely to see a huge bounce in traffic due to its virtual reality dinosaurs arcade game based off of Jurassic World, according to SunTrust.
    • The latest Jurassic installment has brought in $333M in U.S. theaters and over $1.06B globally in a strong run that's still going on.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • TSLA

    Musk to visit China this week - Bloomberg

    • Tesla (TSLA +0.2%) CEO Elon Musk plans to visit Shanghai tomorrow and Beijing from Wednesday through Thursday, sources tell Bloomberg.
    • The details on the purpose of the trip aren't known yet, although Musk mentioned last month the company's goal to build a car, battery-pack and powertrain plant in Shanghai.
    • Previously: Tesla drifts higher on report of Musk visit to Shanghai (July 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 60 Comments
  • BLUSF

    BELLUS Health launches early-stage of lead drug BLU-5937 for chronic cough; shares up 4%

    • Thinly traded nano cap BELLUS Health (OTCPK:BLUSF +3.8%) initiates a Phase 1 clinical trial assessing the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of lead candidate BLU-5937, in development for the treatment of chronic cough. Results should be available in Q4.
    • A Phase 2 proof-of-concept study should launch in 2019.
    • Small molecule BLU-5937 is a orally available antagonist of the P2X3 receptor, a validated target for chronic cough. The company says preclinical tests showed that BLU-5937 significantly reduced cough with no taste loss, an unwanted side effect associated with Merck's (MRK -0.1%) P2X3 antagonist gefapixant (MK-7264).
